properties.areaDesc: Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso/Western Hudspeth Counties; Eastern/Central El Paso County; Salt Basin; Otero Mesa; Northern Hudspeth Highlands/Hueco Mountains; Southern Tularosa Basin; Southern Hudspeth Highlands; Western El Paso County; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern Hudspeth County
properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 5 at 5:03AM MST until February 5 at 11:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO IMPACT THE SACRAMENTO MOUNTAINS, THE EASTERN
LOWLANDS OF OTERO COUNTY, EL PASO AND HUDSPETH COUNTY...

.Snow continues to fall across the advisory area. Snow should
taper off as the morning progresses. A snow shower or flurries
will be possible this afternoon, but most precipitation should end
by then.

* WHAT...Snow. 1 to 3 inches of lowland snow expected.

* SNOW AMOUNTS...Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches with
a few localized areas up to 5 inches.

* WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Wednesday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Local areas of up to 5 inches possible
near east slopes of terrain such as the Hueco Mountains.

* WHERE...Hudspeth County and eastern portions of Otero County.

* TIMING...From 11 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Snowfall will create slick roads and reduce
visibility making for hazardous travel conditions. Road
closures will be possible, including I-10 through Hudspeth
County.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING
